page.title: 07GAMEKEEPING
page.content: We interviewed the head keeper of Manydown Park. He has been a keeper for thirty_six years and head keeper with a tied house for the last nine.His work involves both raising pheasant,partridge and deer for sport and generally managing the wildlife of the area.Manydown Park is very conservation oriented and all the hedges are retained.In addition six metre square of ground has been left comeletely natural for several years.Thirty_five species of butterfly (as opposed to nine before) and the increasing number of beetles has caused the English partridge population to triple.Although poaching is not a big problem,the keeper has seen and been upset by animals caught and maimed in snares.He is also angered by people setting loose animals like mink.
